name: Struts 1: Avoid unused validation form
description:
An unused validation form indicates that validation logic is not up-to-date.
This rule reports all unused form validator not referencing java class. 
Note that it can be the form name or the action name (in the case of a form shared among different actions)
output:
This report lists all unused validation forms name. It provides the following information:
  Form Validation Full Name
rationale: It is easy for developers to forget to update validation logic when they remove or rename action form mappings. One indication that validation logic is not being properly maintained is the presence of an unused validation form.
remediation: Update the validation.xml's entries according to the form used in your application.
remediationSample:
----> validation.xml:
<form-validation>
  <formset> // FIXED
    <form name="logonForm">
      <field property="username" 
            depends="required">
        <arg0 key="prompt.username"/>
      </field>
    </form>
  </formset>
</form-validation>
sample:
----> struts-config.xml:
<action-mapping>
  <action path="/logon"
         type="com.cast.struts.sample.LogonAction"
         name="logonForm"/>
</action-mapping>

<form-beans>
  <form-bean name="logonForm"
            type="com.cast.struts.sample.LogonForm"/>
</form-beans>

----> validation.xml:

<form-validation>
  <formset>
    <form name="logonForm">
      <field property="username" 
            depends="required">
        <arg0 key="prompt.username"/>
      </field>
    </form>
   <form name="addressForm"> // VIOLATION: this form or action-mapping doesn't exist
      ...
   </form>
  </formset>
</form-validation>
alternativeName: Ensure to update the validation.xml's entries according to the form used in your application
